featured.text: They may also pretend to be 14 customers, arguing with a salesperson without a good reason.
The city declared a state of emergency and began aerial spraying of a pesticide to kill the mosquitoes, even though residents argued that the pesticide could be more dangerous than the disease.
To argue for the benefits of nopales.

By contrast, men are much more likely to interrupt (about three times as often in some studies), to argue about what has been said, to ignore or respond poorly to what has been said, to introduce more new topics into the conversation, and to make more assertions.

other.text: Supporters of casual office wear also argue that a casual dress code helps them save money.
The angry passengers argued ______ with the airline staff because their flight was cancelled without any reason.
In making a case for or against zoos, both sides argue that they’re saving animals.

definition.en_def: To present reasons for or against something in a discussion or debate.
definition.example: They often argue about politics during family gatherings.
